sub_title: Director Biostatistics and Data Management at Haleon
summary:
Billy holds a Doctor of Philosophy degree in Statistics from the Florida State University. He has been supporting clinical development, medical affairs, and real-world research in various leadership roles in the pharmaceutical industry for over 15 years.  For a significant portion of his career he has provided statistical support for clinical trial design, analysis, and reporting for phase 1 through phase 4 trials and studies with expertise on advanced statistical issues such as sample size and power estimation for non-standard designs, development of appropriate statistical tests for unique clinical endpoints, and design of adaptive clinical trials.   His statistical design toolbox includes Monte Carlo simulation, application of distribution theory, and experience using cutting-edge Bayesian design software and group-sequential design software.   In the most recent years he has supported real-world evidence studies covering safety outcomes research, comparative effectiveness research, health economics, and commercial analytics.
Throughout his career he has supported clinical and real-world research in the areas of cardiology, oncology, urology, infectious disease, nephrology, neurology, and dermatology. Billy’s broad experience across geographic regions, pharmaceutical company divisions, and therapeutics enables him to rapidly understand his customer’s objectives, needs, and challenges and to then engage in a solutions-oriented dialogue with his clients.

authors.headline: Director Biostatistics and Data Management at Haleon

profile_positions.description: Lead and manage a team of experts in biostatistics, data management, and statistical programming providing robust statistical evidence on preclinical and clinical studies, health outcomes, and other clinical evidence studies conducted globally.
profile_positions.title: Director Biostatistics and Data Management

profile_positions.description: Lead and manage a team of experts in biostatistics, data management, and statistical programming providing robust statistical evidence on preclinical and clinical studies, health outcomes, and other clinical evidence studies conducted globally.
profile_positions.title: Director Biostatistics and Data Management

profile_positions.description: European network of excellence for Big Data in prostate cancer. I am a participant within Work Package 5 "Data Analytics".
profile_positions.title: PIONEER Consortium - Partner Member

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for teams supporting clinical trials and real-world evidence studies in the areas of:
1. Statistics - design, execution, and reporting of clinical trials for regulatory submissions including complex adaptive designs and multiplicity adjustments
2. Statistical Programming - creating and documenting programs for the creation of study tables, listings, and figures and CDISC data
3. Data Science - pre-planned and ad hoc analysis of real-world data sources or clinical study data in the support of real-world evidence using methods spanning simple descriptive statistics to advanced machine learning applications
4. Data Management - design of study-specific eCRFs and surveys along with associated databases with data cleaning and central risk-based monitoring activities
5. Medical and Safety - monitoring of patient safety within clinical trials

Key therapeutic focus areas include Cardio-Renal-Metabolic diseases, Immunology, and central nervous system.
profile_positions.title: Head of Data Science, Data Management, Medical & Safety

profile_positions.description: A Horizon 2020 project on COVID-19.  I am the Industry Lead for Work Packages 3 "Study Design, Execution, and Analysis" and 5 "Data Management".
profile_positions.title: COVID-RED Partner Member

profile_positions.description:
Leading the Analytics and Methodology team for Astellas's RWI division – data processing, data science and methodology / innovation. Working collaboratively with all parts of the Astellas business to appropriately and effectively leverage real-world data.
•	Lead a team responsible for realizing the value of real-world data through protocolized studies, custom programming, automation, data mining, and machine learning
•	Responsible for working with other members in the RWI function to enable efficient and effective project execution for projects sourced from the business 
•	Manage the Analytics team to serve the broad needs of Astellas across multiple geographies (US, Europe and Asia), multiple functions (drug discovery, development, sales and marketing, HEOR, medical and PV) and multiple use cases (e.g. publications, internal decision making, hypothesis generation, etc.)
•	Design and lead deployment of the analytics services resource model consisting of internal and external resources (contractors and employees) 
•	Manage workload and resourcing of projects among data-processing resources, programmers, data scientists and statisticians/methodologists in the RWI function
profile_positions.title: Sr. Director - Head of Analytics, Real-World Informatics

profile_positions.description:
Functional management of a group of 7 statisticians responsible for all statistical aspects of drug development within assigned therapeutic areas.  This includes development and maintenance of excellence in design, analysis, and reporting, and the successful application of statistical expertise to all phases of drug development.  Contribution to the department's mission, objectives and strategic planning along with creation and use of departmental standards, processes, and tools for the design, execution, and reporting of clinical trials.  Responsible for the optimal development, allocation, and management of lead and study statisticians for my therapeutic areas.  As a Director I:
•	Participate in development of long-term departmental objectives and plans
•	Contribute to the creation and management of departmental budgets
•	Recruit, coach, develop, support, supervise, and retain statisticians
•	Manage and allocate resources and appraise performance
•	Provide leadership which inspires individuals to high-quality, timely, and compliant performance
•	Provide expert statistical input into development programs and guidance to my team in their application of cutting-edge statistical methods
•	Collaborate internally and externally to influence development of organizational best practices and ensure excellence in study and project teams
profile_positions.title: Director Biostatistics
Director Health Economics and Clinical Outcomes Research - Statistics

profile_positions.description: Independent biostatistics lead supporting the HECOR group. Responsible for multiple HECOR epidemiology and outcomes projects. Have provided support in oncology, transplant, vaccines, infectious disease, and cardiovascular imaging areas since joining the group. Lead large and/or complex projects, interacts with cross functional teams, providing support to the projects and accountable for the statistical soundness of all statistical and epidemiological output and deliverables for the assigned projects. Provide leadership and consultancy to other project teams and works directly with the programmers to ensure successful outcome for assigned projects. Ensure creation of, maintenance and adherence to project specific standards with respect to key variables, definitions, statistical methods, analysis plans, data structures and presentation of results.  Ensure availability of in-licensed databases where needed, and planning and conduct of integrated analyses to support the comparative effectiveness mission. Negotiate contracts with data vendors and maintain licenses. Assess hardware and software requirements and oversee the maintenance of all systems. Present interim results and completed projects to appropriate stakeholders.  Work collaboratively with epidemiological counterparts to align the strategic vision across the Astellas organizations. Write or review key study documents to ensure optimal statistical and epidemiological presentation and compliance. These documents include, but are not limited to, protocols, analysis plans, tables, listings, figures and final study reports, and/or manuscripts. Ensure efficient planning, execution and reporting of biostatistical and epidemiological studies and expert review of critical documents.
profile_positions.title: Associate Director Health Economics and Clinical Outcomes Research

profile_positions.description: Activities included serving as the statistical lead on core project development teams which were responsible for the clinical development of all vaccine related compounds, close collaboration with medical and clinical sciences on design of clinical trial protocols, and statistical investigation of available historical and compound-specific data. Served on the Adaptive Design group for evaluating current methodologies and software for the statistics department.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager Biostatistics

profile_positions.description: Activities included increased participation on core project development teams, involvement in the review of studies to be included in the development plan for an Alzheimer’s drug program and a therapeutic vaccine for CMV infection in HCT transplant. Produced group sequential designs for the assessment of futility/efficacy during study conduct. Served on the Adaptive Design group for evaluating current methodologies and software for the statistics department.
profile_positions.title: Biostatistics Manager

profile_positions.description: Activities included original development of a post-marketing clinical trial protocol in cardiac imaging using stress agents. This required significant understanding of the medical and clinical science, investigation of the compound’s Phase 3 trial data, and simulation due to the skewed and discrete nature of the data. Additionally began working in the transplantation therapeutic area and developed the statistical analysis plan and interim analysis plan for a DSMB for a Phase 2 trial in kidney transplantation. Selected to participate in a trans-Atlantic exchange program with the European offices. Activities during my assignment to Europe included development of Phase 4 clinical trials protocols in kidney transplantation, and creation of the statistical analysis plan and end of study analyses for an already initiated Phase 2 kidney transplant trial. Emphasis was placed on learning regulatory requirements and work practices within the European region of Astellas.
profile_positions.title: Principal Statistician
